FuncDef: The pki rsa local-key-pair destroy command deletes the specified RSA key pair. The pki rsa local-key-pair destroy command deletes the specified RSA key pair.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of the RSA key pair to be deleted.
The value must be the name of an existing key pair.

Examples: [~HUAWEI] pki import rsa-key-pair test pem pki01_rsa.pem
The current password is required, please enter the password <length 1-32>:
Are you sure you want to delete the key pair? [y/n]:y
ExtraInfo: It is recommended that you run this command to destroy the specified RSA key pair if it is leaked, damaged, unused, or lost.
